intro: Verbascum hinkei, commonly known as the Hinkes mullein, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Verbascum hinkei is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. It is a hardy perennial that can tolerate drought conditions and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
